      • getCustomerPasswordHistory

        public AdminCustomerPasswordHistory[] getCustomerPasswordHistory(int userId,
                                                                 int maxRows)
                                                          throws KKAdminException
        Get a maximum of maxRows CustomerPasswordHistory records belonging to the specified custId. The results will be ordered by dateCreated descending so if maxRows is 1 only the most recent CustomerPasswordHistory is returned.
        Specified by:
        getCustomerPasswordHistory in interface AdminCustomerPwdHistMgrIf
        Parameters:
        userId - the userId whose records to return
        maxRows - a maximum of this many records will be returned
        Returns:
        an array of CustomerPasswordHistory records, ordered by dateCreated descending
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - if theres's an unexpected problem

      • checkPasswordValidity

        public boolean checkPasswordValidity(java.lang.String password,
                                     int userId)
                              throws KKAdminException
        Description copied from interface: AdminCustomerPwdHistMgrIf
        Is the password valid?
        Specified by:
        checkPasswordValidity in interface AdminCustomerPwdHistMgrIf
        Parameters:
        password - the new Password to check for validity
        userId - the user that the password belongs to
        Returns:
        true if the password is valid otherwise an exception is thrown
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - if there's an unexpected problem or the password is found to be invalid. If the password is found to be invalid the msgKey attribute of the KKAdminException will contain a message catalogue key that references a message that explains why.

      • prunePasswordHistory

        public void prunePasswordHistory(int custId)
                          throws KKAdminException
        Prune old CustomerPasswordHistory records. Since we only check up to a certain number of records in the history as defined in the konakartadmin.properties file we need to prune away the records we no longer need.
        Specified by:
        prunePasswordHistory in interface AdminCustomerPwdHistMgrIf
        Parameters:
        custId - the customerId of the records to prune
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - if theres's an unexpected problem
